OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OnyonBootUp:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="0a63e05d1c694319bc374139251e6f37" Scale="1"/]I had barely begun my search when a
strange thing reared up as if it were
waiting for me. It then dropped a single
seed. It resembles a vegetable on my
home planet called an onion. I shall call
this an [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Onion[System:Color name="Default"] too. Its sprout glows and
sways as if inviting me to come closer.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminRed:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="808e6fb3c94d4cd7bfbf16354d89e0b2" Scale="1"/]A fascinating creature emerged when
I plucked the sprout! I tried to put
some distance between us, but it
followed me close behind. It seems
quite friendly and looks similar to a
Pikpik Carrot, my favorite vegetable.
I'll call it a "[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"]."
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_CollectPellet:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="87ca087a85534458bd90f3e39bf84d39" Scale="1"/]The seedlike thing I harvested from
that flower must be some kind of food
that propagates more Pikmin. I will call
these condensed nutrients "[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]pellets[System:Color name="Default"]"
and the plant a "[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Pellet Posy[System:Color name="Default"]."
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OnyonPullout:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="bdb3516648484cb784a73a6e4a89291b" Scale="1"/]As evening fell, the Pikmin climbed
back up into the Onion and took to
the skies alongside the S.S. Dolphin.
Astonishing! The Onion must be both
a[System:Color name="Emphasis" ] nest[System:Color name="Default"] and a [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]form of transportation[System:Color name="Default"]!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminLimitOver:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="ef177d7bfd0246cf9f682aa826f8df4c" Scale="1"/]The Onion stopped releasing seeds!
I went to check on it and saw that the
Pikmin [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]will only propagate inside the
Onion once a certain number[System:Color name="Default"] are out
on the surface. Could limiting the
number of active Pikmin be a strategy
to avoid extinction?
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_NotIncrease:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="91f1fe4893a94aa88aecf5a05ae4fd99" Scale="1"/][System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Wild Pikmin [System:Color name="Default"]found underground can be
brought to the surface and added to
an Onion. However, when tasked with
transporting a pellet, the resulting
seed ends up the same color as the
Onion. I must be careful, as these
Pikmin [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]cannot be propagated[System:Color name="Default"] right now.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminZenmetsu:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="d1b9d12772a24b74adae4e260f7cf623" Scale="1"/]I got careless...and all the Pikmin
perished as a result. Horrified, I made
my way back to the base, only to find
that the Onion had released [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]1 Pikmin
seed[System:Color name="Default"]! This behavior likely developed to
prevent extinction. I've sworn to take
better care next time. Cross my heart.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_MitsuSui:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="25f67720531f49dfb630bb7bb6425c4e" Scale="1"/]I've noticed that when they consume
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]nectar[System:Color name="Default"], a flower immediately blooms on
a Pikmin's head. Yet, when they mature
in the ground from a sprout, their leaf
becomes a bud before a flower. Either
way, the more they grow, the[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ] faster
Pikmin become[System:Color name="Default"].[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ] [System:Color name="Default"]That could be useful...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_CarrySpeedUp:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="05d050f4b0a44e0d9c6cb75e8c06e77b" Scale="1"/]By working together, Pikmin can carry
objects much heavier than themselves.
And if you increase the number of
Pikmin doing the transporting, they
will [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]transport objects even faster[System:Color name="Default"]!
Just think how much our kind could
learn from this cooperative species.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_MajorityVote:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="89132714b865404198ac68dc29298be4" Scale="1"/]After closely observing the Pikmin
carrying their prey to the Onion, I saw
that the next seeds the Onion dropped
were the [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]same type as the majority of
the Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"] that did the transporting.
How fascinating that Pikmin ecology
employs a concept like [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]majority rule[System:Color name="Default"]!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_StatePikminCommon:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="5447d15e94564591aa74c78c6cd594e2" Scale="1"/]Whenever their underlings are in a bad
spot, it's a leader's duty to remain
calm, quickly assess the situation, and
form a plan of action. For example,
when the Pikmin are in trouble and
start to panic, [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]I calm them and
reengage their focus using my whistle[System:Color name="Default"].
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_StatePikminCold:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="860195c45a6740399bb9c304115a6f35" Scale="1"/]It was eerily quiet earlier, and I turned
around to see the Pikmin were all just
standing there, trembling! Perhaps the
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]cold temperature[System:Color name="Default"] put them in that
state, because even the sound of my
whistle only briefly alleviated the
issue. I must get to the root of this...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_StatePikminCharm:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="82ae3965f8d4404ba18ef6b3febf7e62" Scale="1"/]How alarming! For some undiscernible
reason, the Pikmin won't look at me!
Even when I call them with my whistle!
They always gladly followed me until
now... Have they [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]lost their senses[System:Color name="Default"]?
I must do something to get them back
on my side.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_LimitThreeColors:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="184138a17cbc4b0680263beaeef3bac9" Scale="1"/]When I brought some wild Pikmin found
in a cave up to the surface, not all the
Pikmin exited the research pod. There
must be a[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ] limit on how many Pikmin can
be out on the surface at a time[System:Color name="Default"], and
it seems there can be [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]3 types at most[System:Color name="Default"].
The rest I'll return to the Onion.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_34:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="c1602425b13749aeb79fd319fca779f4" Scale="1"/]Fire should be a natural enemy of
the Pikmin, but [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Red Pikmin continue
through the flames[System:Color name="Default"] where other Pikmin
would burn... Their[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ] attacks are also a
little bit stronger[System:Color name="Default"] than those of the
other Pikmin. Could these qualities
be somehow related?
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminYellow:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="2aae71170500406aa88aef7538952d66" Scale="1"/]I've decided to call the yellow-colored
Pikmin with large earlike appendages
"[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Yellow Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"]." I liked that name a lot
more than Ear Pikmin. They're [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]resistant
to electricity[System:Color name="Default"], and they [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]fly high[System:Color name="Default"] when
thrown. Plus, they're [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]good at digging[System:Color name="Default"]!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminBlue:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="6ba30b57716a401ea46de4b9a53870a7" Scale="1"/]At a glance, the [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Blue Pikmin [System:Color name="Default"]appear to
have mouthlike gills and are notably
able to function even underwater.
Thanks to their [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]water resistance[System:Color name="Default"] and
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]swimming talents[System:Color name="Default"], I can now transport
things found in the water.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminIce:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="4c006fa01a43418ebc149075861e9197" Scale="1"/]I always thought of Pikmin as plantlike
creatures, so I never dreamed I'd come
across an ice variant! [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Ice Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"] can
use their icy bodies to [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]freeze water
and creatures[System:Color name="Default"], but they also [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]float [System:Color name="Default"]like
ice [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]in the water[System:Color name="Default"]. Don't spray them with
water though. They really don't like it.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminRock:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="aea3522b484b4a7fab391438beda606c" Scale="1"/]Ah, the hard, rocky [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Rock Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"]. They
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]break crystal walls [System:Color name="Default"]with their stout
bodies and tough headbutts, [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]survive
being stepped on[System:Color name="Default"], and [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]can't be pierced
[System:Color name="Default"]by needles. Despite their sturdiness,
they can still be crushed on hard
surfaces or by some creatures' teeth.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminWing:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="a0bd89a2e91f4aa2960fa00606cb1ee6" Scale="1"/]As their name suggests, [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Winged Pikmin
[System:Color name="Default"]have sprouted wings and can [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]fly[System:Color name="Default"].
Of course, this means they can
transport things by air and [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]can save
time[System:Color name="Default"] that way. Their ground attacks
are lackluster, but when it comes to
aerial combat, they're unmatched.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminPurple:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="ab75806a518d4ea18f60607a0d864961" Scale="1"/]One [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Purple Pikmin [System:Color name="Default"]has the [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]strength and
weight of 10 [System:Color name="Default"]regular Pikmin. What they
lack in speed, they make up for in
force! [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]When thrown, their impact [System:Color name="Default"]is
powerful enough to emit gravitational
waves. They're only found underground,
so I must handle with care.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_PikminWhite:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="e8a709d0fb4d446eaed928caae2aa629" Scale="1"/]Rare [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]White Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"] come from white
Candypop Buds that bloom in caves.
They're small and notably [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]fast on their
feet[System:Color name="Default"], but their attacks are lacking.
Imbued with enough [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]poison[System:Color name="Default"] to be lethal
to a Bulborb, these wily Pikmin are
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]resistant to poisonous gas[System:Color name="Default"] themselves.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_15:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="c518bbd7c24e44fdae0fb3985cb354f3" Scale="1"/]Sometimes, when they're in a pleasant
mood, the Pikmin will start to sing a
little tune. Feeling inspired, I tried to
join in...until they went noticeably
silent. I suppose my singing doesn't
appeal to their musical tastes.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OnyonCarryBoost:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="88c9f03e849648b09cb36f720bdcbaa5" Scale="1"/]When an Onion absorbs this whitish
bulb, it seems to perk up and [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]increases
[System:Color name="Default"]the Pikmin you can lead by [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]10[System:Color name="Default"]. The
scent reminds me of the garlic on my
planet. I'm tempted to have a nibble,
but for now I'll just call it "[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]flarlic[System:Color name="Default"]" and
leave the taste test for another day.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_CombineOnyon:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="7b9903d3c76d4b5ab3fd7aa0393014ce" Scale="1"/]After being transported, the new
Onion I found was absorbed by the
first Onion! Could this be cannibalism?!
I investigated the matter, and it looks
like[System:Color name="Emphasis" ] [System:Color name="Default"]a[System:Color name="Emphasis" ] new type of Pikmin can now be
withdrawn[System:Color name="Default"] from the Onion. This must
mean that Onions can [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]fuse [System:Color name="Default"]together.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_CollectOnyonTwice:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="4cb2ebe338904e36abcba82f4b9431a1" Scale="1"/]I found another Onion the same color
as a previously fused Onion but had it
transported anyway. When fed to the
other Onion, [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]20[System:Color name="Default"] Pikmin seeds of its
color [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]were propagated[System:Color name="Default"]! Absorbing one
of your own species for nutrients is a
horrifying yet impressive power move.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Discovery_Pongashi:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="294c263192d3478497b18af859111421" Scale="1"/]As we approached the giant flower,
the Pikmin looked at me as though
begging to be thrown inside. So I tried
it, and with a POP the[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ] flower released
a Pikmin seed the same color as itself[System:Color name="Default"].
The sound reminded me of my favorite
candy, so I'll call it a "[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Candypop Bud[System:Color name="Default"]."
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_CollectPodTsuyu10:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="4f49752193cf43b0a5ed7bc238644edd" Scale="1"/]Upon closer inspection, I was shocked
to discover that an Ultra-Spicy Berry
contains a large quantity of [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]ultra-spicy
essence[System:Color name="Default"]! I've collected [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]1 bottle's worth
of nectar from 10 berries[System:Color name="Default"], but what do
I do with it? This stuff is way too hot
for us sweet-toothed Hocotatians.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_SuckHotExtract:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="1c3dd97e1bff4229bd27cdb383210795" Scale="1"/]On rare occasions, a red nectar will
emerge from nectar eggs, and it
contains quite a lot of [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]ultra-spicy
essence[System:Color name="Default"]! Considering that it holds [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]10
Ultra-Spicy Berries' worth[System:Color name="Default"] of it, I'm not
surprised I'm already sweating. I'll have
to bottle this up with extreme caution.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_UseGekikaraSpray:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="d5109caa15aa4683807e1e29fba5bbcf" Scale="1"/]The Pikmin and [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] were sprayed
with Ultra-Spicy Spray today. I quickly
ran to clean it off, but when I saw that
their [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]movement had become animated
[System:Color name="Default"]and that the Pikmin's [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]flowers had
bloomed[System:Color name="Default"], I realized the spray must be
a source of energy for these species!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area500_NearSpaceShip:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="ad076794ef5e449f9ff98486b57a1572" Scale="1"/]After thorough investigation into the
shiny objects found on this planet,
I have deduced that they must contain
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]sparklium[System:Color name="Default"]. I feel giddy to have found
real-life [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]treasure[System:Color name="Default"], but my focus must
remain on my main objective—finding
the missing parts of the S.S. Dolphin.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_DiscoverySizai:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="0e42213f860249eba403c5837082e668" Scale="1"/]One could mistake this [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Sizai" scale="0.66"/][System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]raw material
[System:Color name="Default"]for a simple stone, but it has more in
common with amber and other
fossilized biological matter. When
heated, it melts into a brown [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Sizai_Clay" scale="0.66"/]clay
and becomes malleable. I should be
able to find many applications for it.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_09:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="070b9a7cb88f47d99b5f5ba2702930cd" Scale="1"/]Battling creatures on this planet is
hard work, but it would be a lot easier
if they didn't move so much. That's why
I plan to [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]freeze [System:Color name="Default"]them with Ice Pikmin or
an Ice Blast! Then I'll charge them all
at once. If I can freeze the flying kind
in midair, I'll strike once they fall!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_DiscoveryTanebiStation:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="801b3f5635fd4c62b1e7fdcf5c9be1f9" Scale="1"/]Harnessing fire is the cornerstone of
civilization. With a [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]fire starter[System:Color name="Default"], you can
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]burn things[System:Color name="Default"] or [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]create warmth[System:Color name="Default"]. I could
also use it to build fires in other areas,
as long as I light them before the
fire starter itself goes out.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_10:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="55185e047a0848769b66c64f84301531" Scale="1"/]I've often heard the saying "Don't
push it, pull it!" But I might like "Don't
hit it, tug it!" even better. I have a
theory that I could use the suction
mechanism used for collecting ship
parts to [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]knock a breadbug's head into
the ship's hull[System:Color name="Default"]. That'd do some damage.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area001_FirstExitCave:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="203383e0e37c479294fdb8a699308c2d" Scale="1"/]Upon returning to the surface after
exploring underground, I noticed the
hands of my clock had barely moved at
all, and I had been down there for
hours! I can only assume that on this
planet, [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]time flows differently [System:Color name="Default"]on the
surface than it does underground.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_HurryUp:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="7bdf1ff536424eab9e3bde0745b1907d" Scale="1"/]Many creatures become more active at
night, so Pikmin left on the surface are
doomed to be eaten. [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]If you're close to
the Onion, you can return them safely
inside.[System:Color name="Default"] Stray Pikmin, on the other
hand... l must remember to [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]call them
back to the squad[System:Color name="Default"] before sunset.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_CaveEnemyRespawn:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="c1f3c3228dba41278584fc54acf1bf0a" Scale="1"/]I was sure I had scoured [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]100%[System:Color name="Default"] of a
cave before returning to the surface,
only to casually reenter it and find it
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]teeming with the creatures I thought I
had defeated[System:Color name="Default"]! Or perhaps others of
their kind have claimed the territory.
The underground bursts with life!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_04:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="9b0cae8f024d446c90573ccc20076007" Scale="1"/]Bomb Rocks show no signs of working
against this creature, never mind
Pikmin attacks! Does its [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]body not
actually exist[System:Color name="Default"] in this dimension?
Maybe if I hit it with a gravitational
wave, the dimensions will converge and
it will show itself. But is that possible?
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave001:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="a91fe3afad1e4e0da19544d10fedc849" Scale="1"/]I entered a cave to look for S.S. Dolphin
parts and found a creature that defies
the logic of space! It further surprised
me by expelling frigid-cold air. Imagine
if there were [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Pikmin that had been
acclimatized to that cold air[System:Color name="Default"]... This
planet's ecosystem is full of mysteries.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave002:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="4d5aede44e964a29b3dbae3ad21a44c3" Scale="1"/]I was feeling hotter than usual in my
space suit, and when I looked down, the
ground was on fire! I panicked, but a
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Red Pikmin [System:Color name="Default"]just gave me a sidelong
glance, [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]totally unfazed even as the fire
licked at them[System:Color name="Default"]. They're clearly capable
of more than just skillful attacks.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave005:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="a79eb6046f99416d920ce555cabd7ac5" Scale="1"/]The ground...it started moving!
I groped for a way forward, but
[System:Color name="Emphasis" ]I couldn't make any progress on my
own[System:Color name="Default"]. I wonder if [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] may be able to
[System:Color name="Emphasis" ]help [System:Color name="Default"]me out of this mess...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave004:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="649c981e53e6406a845c761f70a68b2e" Scale="1"/]I found a [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]hole that should lead out to
the top of the mountain[System:Color name="Default"], but the inside
was more convoluted than expected,
and only now do I see a light at the end
of the tunnel. If I ever make it out of
this place, I'll deserve a good rest.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave033:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="1793912e527444188b2b7861604b795c" Scale="1"/]Someone or something built a rough
wall inside the cave. The Pikmin and I
were able to scramble up, but [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]
was [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]unable to climb up the wall[System:Color name="Default"].
I'll have to leave her behind for now
and hope we can find a way or a place
to [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]meet up[System:Color name="Default"].
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave006:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="6eda1aa7319e45a0aee37b1a1b73b454" Scale="1"/]Beneath the passage, all I can see is
an [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]interminable darkness[System:Color name="Default"]. I tossed a
pebble into the abyss but never heard
it hit the ground. I must proceed with
caution here. I don't want any Pikmin
accidentally thrown to their demise,
let alone shaken off by some creature.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave007:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="5231aabb0da54bdeb344bf9925b12142" Scale="1"/]In the natural world, there are many
examples of strategic [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]mimicry[System:Color name="Default"], where
one lulls their prey into perceived
safety...but I never thought I would
witness it firsthand! I now know danger
can lurk in even the jiggliest of places.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave009:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="9f81787232c24815bedca9ed27fd1736" Scale="1"/]A [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]cave of utter darkness[System:Color name="Default"] into which
almost no light filters. I explored for a
bit, relying on the glowing mushrooms
to guide the way, but I turned back to
avoid unnecessary risk. I wish I had a
better [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Headlamp [System:Color name="Default"]at my disposal. I'm
starting to regret this bargain buy.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave010:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="9e63ab3cda5a43078e5bda50929a01a8" Scale="1"/]Many types of [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Bulblax [System:Color name="Default"]have settled in
this cave. Perhaps they're building
their empire... To them, I'm just a
foreign invader that must be
eradicated. If the danger becomes
unavoidable, I'll need to rely on some
of the items I brought with me.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave011:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="56bcdf53096045048657d5ed2526a2e3" Scale="1"/]What beautiful scenery! When I'm
surrounded by water, I can't help but
feel at one with the sea. Sadly, there
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]aren't many places to land in here[System:Color name="Default"], so
nonswimming Pikmin aren't able to do
much. At least I got to pretend I was
on vacation for a little while, right?
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave012:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="869e2319bc5147ac894c4a3cdcc6d921" Scale="1"/]The temperature keeps dropping the
further I dive underground. It's as if I'm
in a sauna, but the air is stiflingly cold
instead of hot. My space suit protects
me, but the Pikmin keep shivering.
I wonder if there's a way I could
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]warm them up[System:Color name="Default"] down here...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave013:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="a8f44304555f4b20802e501f3321604e" Scale="1"/]While traversing the darkness, I came
upon a delightful yet nostalgic object
of mystery! Powerful streams of light,
nonstop beats that assault the
senses, a haze of smoke and music,
and [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]dancing Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"]! It's like being back
in the discotheques of my youth!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave014:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="7b036fdfec8449558ab14dcce2b890c4" Scale="1"/]Shortly into my explorations, a loud
BANG echoed throughout the cave.
My memory's been clouded by fear,
but I do recall that [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]there[System:Color name="Default"] [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]was nothing
I could do with the[System:Color name="Default"] [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Blue Pikmin [System:Color name="Default"]I'd
brought with me, and I ran away in
desperation. The rest is a mystery...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave021:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="98ae45ebda714243ab88ebdf8e8b85f2" Scale="1"/]I keep commanding [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] to follow
a scent, and she keeps leading me
completely off track! There must be
some [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]creature [System:Color name="Default"]down here emitting an
unusual smell that can [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]trick [System:Color name="Default"]not just
[Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] and the Pikmin but my sensors
too! What a deceptive ecosystem...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave022:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="b0087144bab54167aaf2ffc2b3b76197" Scale="1"/]The flaming entrance was so hot,
I never could have made my way in
without a [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Scorch Guard[System:Color name="Default"]. The true
surprise was that once I got further
into the cave, it was like [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]walking into a
cold refrigerator[System:Color name="Default"]. Hopefully the Red
Pikmin, [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/], and I get through this...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave023:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="be65aacfc8964fd5bceb745d986fc995" Scale="1"/]Everywhere I look in this cave reminds
me of home. Playing together with the
children. Sitting around the table,
sharing a meal as a family...as the
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]dog pilfers my side dish[System:Color name="Default"]. Just that
humdrum, routine, irreplaceable
everyday life.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_03_Title: [UE:Meta key="2fbd73fd4dfb42dcad464a9b4ad3a6af" Scale="1"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] and the Pikmin
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_03:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="a55d040ae6ab46d285efbe37c00b6fd8" Scale="1"/]I don't believe I've ever seen a space
dog like [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] before. First of all, she's
huge, but she also has an adorable [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]leaf[System:Color name="Default"]
at the tip of her tail. She seems to get
on quite well with the Pikmin. I can't
help but wonder if there's some kind
of connection between them.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_SmellSearch:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="c10052bc13054277a970e49b733d1ad8" Scale="1"/]After training [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] to track a variety
of scents, she can now not only sniff
out the missing parts of the S.S.
Dolphin but also [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]Pikmin of whatever
type I specify[System:Color name="Default"] and even [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]stray Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"].
She's already proving to be a
trusty partner.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_20:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="ac6b66ac292344df83d412065eb7c7c7" Scale="1"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] has shown herself to be a very
talented swimmer. She can[System:Color name="Emphasis" ] transport
nonswimming Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"] across the water
by carrying them on her back. To be
honest, she could probably teach me a
thing or two. I can't even swim in space
if I don't have my favorite space float.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_17:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="cabda0187e4345759e2b2fa78cee9d27" Scale="1"/]Since the first time I shared a
Scrummy Bone with [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] when she
was acting hungry, she wags her tail
furiously and starts begging as soon
as I start opening our bag of space
food. It's delightful to watch, as long
as our food supplies last...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_05:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="f2eed77bc153489c953d730ac113daf1" Scale="1"/]Some of the objects I call treasure
seem to be more complex than they
initially appear. It makes me wonder...
Who made these? And where are they?
I don't sense their presence here at
all, but I suppose they could be hiding
in the shadows, secretly watching me.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Base:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="b0bd9bfb181a44dba8b435ad3d8e395c" Scale="1"/]I keep coming across [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]ruins of some
sort...rings made of stones[System:Color name="Default"]. I've been
using them as a base to land on, and
the more I think about it, they seem to
be designed exactly for that purpose!
Could it be a coincidence? I'd like to
know who made them in the first place.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_06:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="1edddbb3226b4bffbdfcb5b149c3b72c" Scale="1"/]The atmosphere on this planet
contains large amounts of [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]poisonous
oxygen[System:Color name="Default"]. I doubt that my space suit's
life-support system can hold out for
more than a few days now. Maybe if I
had a[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ] leaf[System:Color name="Default"], like [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] or the Pikmin...
What a silly thought.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_11:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="eb2931ffe63e4486881abf1f68b43e1f" Scale="1"/]I was so hungry earlier that I mistook
a Pikmin for a Pikpik Carrot and almost
bit right into it! The Pikmin are friendly
to me right now, but who knows how
long our relationship will last?
I quickly apologized to the terrified
Pikmin and gave it a hug.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_16:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="bf46ce54b64c422096302b43eeae1569" Scale="1"/]This area is blooming with radiant
blossoms. I recall how, in the spring,
I would go for a stroll just to enjoy the
flowers in my neighborhood on Planet
Hocotate. Imagining my dog frolicking
underneath the falling petals seemed
to put my troubled mind at ease.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_07:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="fd8c6e1aef7c4b2480193afdce5ffad3" Scale="1"/]Under a setting sun, I've played
catch with my son and comforted my
daughter as she fretted over the
growing darkness. It's where I first fell
in love with my wife's smile, long ago.
The twilight of this planet brings back
distant memories of Hocotate.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_12:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="e513f98e46ca4ee0bccd8b9e09a12bd0" Scale="1"/]Last night, I dreamt that one of my
subordinates made a terrible mistake
that put the company in a huge amount
of debt. Too big for Hocotate Freight
to pay back quickly... This is why I
never take on debt. Anyway, when I
woke up, I burst into a fit of laughter!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_01:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="f1dfaeb9e3f247b6bf3fedccb4ddaa53" Scale="1"/]My wife loves my cooking. Whenever I
whip something up in an effort to do
something special, she asks me,
"Why can't you do this every day? Not
just for the holidays!" I always take it
as a compliment. I really miss those
days. Simpler times...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_18:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="335fc18aa26045a09d493682966ec520" Scale="1"/]Though I find myself stranded here,
I know my daughter must be getting
lovelier by the day. It's a terrible
shame that I can't be there to see her
grow up... Of course, if I was there
now, I'm sure she'd just brush me off
and yell, "Go away, Dad!"
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_19:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="5d6e605971af4f41b45947947fa03838" Scale="1"/]My son constantly picks up bugs and
animals, and my wife always scolds him
for it. But I'd like him to pursue his
interests and treasure his curiosity
for living things. If I showed him the
notes I've made about the creatures
here, I'm sure his eyes would light up!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_35:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="21bbb63530de401186501a061de9960f" Scale="1"/]It is very strange... The scenery of this
planet, which I once found hostile, now
sometimes strikes me as surprisingly
serene. Perhaps I owe this feeling of
peace to the Pikmin and our friendship.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_31:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="3cd4db3b4a8749b793888d53fde2b108" Scale="1"/]I wonder if these Pikmin were waiting
for me to arrive. On this planet, they
are a weak species, but if they're
trying to use the power of an alien
brain to climb to the top of the
natural order... I have to wonder if it
isn't me who is being used by them.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_32:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="1fa64d9c0b294270bab0bacca90d1aaf" Scale="1"/]I had a horrific dream last night.
After I met my doom facing off against
a creature, the Pikmin carried me back
to their Onion. I've often thought that
we might share a powerful bond, but
perhaps that was only wishful thinking.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_33: [Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="654c69a2cc3b44c9b6d1fc248d47b44f" Scale="1"/][System:Color name="Warning" ]I am so very tired...[System:Color name="Default"]
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OlimarMemo03:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="59e1092057b2444fa66d1034086b5868" Scale="1"/]At long last, my goal to collect all lost
S.S. Dolphin parts is nearly complete.
According to the ship's radar, the
remaining pieces are [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]inside a giant
structure[System:Color name="Default"]... My life-support system is
reaching its limit. One last push now.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area010_Prologue_FirstWave:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="cdff829619304641a290cce60f3b042e" Scale="1"/]I'm so close to fully repairing the
S.S. Dolphin. The remaining parts
should be somewhere inside this giant
structure that I've never seen before.
It's as if the [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]rules of logic I've come to
understand may not apply[System:Color name="Default"] here.
I'll have to explore carefully now...
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area010_JoinPikmin:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="8fd74a1b9cbc4c8f98b50a8c5630d85e" Scale="1"/]When I arrived at this area, the Pikmin
started acting quite strange. They flew
out of the Onion and immediately [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]hid[System:Color name="Default"]!
I can't find my spaceship parts without
them... I suppose I'll just keep looking
for them and can [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]call them back [System:Color name="Default"]using
my whistle.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OlimarMemo02:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="7098be4d4a6c457b9eb1bffc08b0a6c8" Scale="1"/]I've noticed that there are several
items labeled with a [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]strange code[System:Color name="Default"]
strewn about this area. I'm not quite
sure what they are to be used for,
but I should take thorough notes in
case it becomes obvious later.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area010_ExplainBankCard:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="934d4b0216344fa494dcd4124b17d0de" Scale="1"/]I found a [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]bunker [System:Color name="Default"]inside the building!
Thankfully, the entrance has a lock,
so unwanted creatures won't be able
to get in. I can rest easy now, knowing
that I have a safe place to go if I get
stranded here on this planet.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OlimarMemo01_Title: [UE:Meta key="8d0cfc3e209140e2b8721f3697229033" Scale="1"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] the Guard Dog
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_OlimarMemo01:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="1f4b4f54f36e4ee4aac54468aa51e219" Scale="1"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] has been guarding the outside of
the bunker for me while I rest. She's
also been [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]gathering up Pikmin[System:Color name="Default"], though
it's unclear where she's finding them.
Either way, I feel so lucky to have
[Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] by my side in all this.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area010_Prologue_SecondWave:
[Npc:Icon chara="Olimar"/][UE:Meta key="aee5e09afa964b7c87ba28558e2427eb" Scale="1"/]This is [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="CaptainOlimar"/]Captain Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]! I'm currently
stranded on an unknown planet in the
far reaches of space. I'm in dire need
of assistance! Please send help as fast
as you can!
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_21:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="45192d6913ea4530ad88dea3f088d703" Scale="1"/]I'm supposed to find [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]. Boss's
orders. Hmm. I don't really remember
what he looks like.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_29:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="d31a623822c4464a926614bdbddb04b0" Scale="1"/]These thingies remind me a lot of
Pikpik Carrots. I'd eat them, but then
who'd carry my snacks? Wish I had a
golden Pikpik Carrot to eat right now.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_23:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="6cdc70d69aa14bb980ac4e8e41d66ef2" Scale="1"/]Got sick of Nana's cookies, so I tried
eating some of the creatures around
here. They're pretty yummy.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_24:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="99446b3982da4be392efd6a71939847c" Scale="1"/]If you don't hurry up and eat these,
they turn hard in the ground. As soon
as I spot one, I dig it up and grill it.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_28:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="5e88aeb75d1f4929a1d24e6f9569c839" Scale="1"/]The stories [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] told were always
boring, but he never got too angry
when I messed up... Still drawing a
blank on his face.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_22:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="339865f9c5b24c66991966818d0947ad" Scale="1"/]Saw something sort of [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] shaped.
It was pretty shaggy and seemed
happy enough. I'll leave it alone for
now. I'd like to ride that green dog
thing it had with it.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_27:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="88f3e3f714dc441c9d16dfe119950f39" Scale="1"/]Mostly been focusing on snacks lately.
Guess I'll just make something up when
I report to the boss.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_30:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="56d3335482c8475bbe08588be6b72af8" Scale="1"/]A green dog thing came up to me.
It could be the one I saw with that
[Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]-ish creature. Must've been
abandoned. Guess I'll keep it.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_36:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="b3e6ea56ee814bcbb8fe449c626fb85f" Scale="1"/]Tried some of that green juice the
things by the hearth were drinking.
Tastes really yummy. It makes my head
and tummy feel all warm and cozy.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_26:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="0be60e465ec5437aacc87a7358aab556" Scale="1"/]・Marinated lip steak
・Claw croquettes with cream sauce
・Roasted leg and miso shells
・Soy-pickled eyeballs
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_25:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="d8d7fef8ea9f43d19de9d86946e5a86c" Scale="1"/]I can pick all the fresh mushrooms I
want here. I'll save some for Nana to
try once I go home.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave024:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="c313ccb06a1e42d39079c14d844b7f37" Scale="1"/]I filled my belly with all kinds of
snacks. The strongest creatures are
the tastiest. Except that [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]ultimate
weapon[System:Color name="Default"]-like one. It was barely edible.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave025:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="9ea229a6fad24789930822364e9c10fd" Scale="1"/]I see a lot of places to mess around
down here. Wouldn't be a bad place to
live. I hid all my snacks in a box, but
forgot the [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]code I need to open it[System:Color name="Default"].
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave026:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="57a24c4e666344439b898bc0c0db87e9" Scale="1"/][System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]So many creatures came toward me
at once[System:Color name="Default"], it was like an all-you-can-eat
buffet. My belly's so full. I couldn't eat
another bite.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave018:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="66e89f6a608048baaf5bd3fe2a381e6a" Scale="1"/]Got stuck in the [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]bottomless swamp[System:Color name="Default"].
Some parts of it were pitch-black. And
now I'm covered in mud. Reminded me
of the mountain behind Nana's house.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave019:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="d304cafbc8df4885bc1cc302d406c3ef" Scale="1"/]I love how [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]sticky[System:Color name="Default"] it is down here.
Plus, I had snacks walking over to me
nonstop. Two of them were really big.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area500_SelfIntroduction_NpcE:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="fea2eb5d93484d758f986f61162dacbe" Scale="1"/]Spotted a [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]huge dog thing[System:Color name="Default"] in the
mushroom forest. I like the one
I have now, but that one looks
more fun. Guess I'll follow it.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Area006_Discovery_LastDungeon:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="110518b730744653a2ee716c5b80abf8" Scale="1"/]Found the huge dog thing near the[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]
large rock at the back of the swamp[System:Color name="Default"].
It had something in its mouth. It was
that [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]pink person[System:Color name="Default"] who had the yummy
juice. She's getting in the way. I'll just
drop her somewhere.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_Cave016:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="267cdaa22e13437f99c158a8d36c64f9" Scale="1"/]Finally tamed that huge dog thing.
I'm gonna lie low for a while in its
den. It's really [System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]deep[System:Color name="Default"], and there are
[System:Color name="LogEmphasis" ]plenty [System:Color name="Default"]of snacks. The others will
give up and go home.
OrimarMemo.OrimarMemo_37:
[Npc:Icon chara="Louie"/][UE:Meta key="071053b616d745a6ab5aefa8745e2e9d" Scale="1"/]My favorite thing in all of space to
eat but hard to come by. If I did find
some, I'd devour them all to my heart's
content. I'm just waiting for the right
delivery job...
